HλLF-LIFE - Legenda a první herní počin od Valve, který inspiroval celý herní průmysl.

It seems pretty lame to play now, but at the time of its release it revolutionized not just the FPS, but the video game industry as a whole, with its remarkably (for the time) awesome AI and fierce support for the modding community.

So many games came from people tinkering around making mods for Half-Life 1, the most notable of them being Counter-Strike and Day of Defeat.

PC Gamer awarded it Game of the Year for like 6 years in a row.

If it's really cheap, pick it up to get a taste of the game that started a new generation of story-line FPS games.

this is it. 

by just adding scripted events and some sort of writing to the linear first person corridor shooter, valve managed to make at least 2 2/3 excellent, timeless video games in this style.

half-life, nearly 20 years on holds its own. 
visually it's not even the best of its time, with tim sweeny's unreal engine already ahead (although probably not as smooth on a machine of that era, but i'm not from that time so correct me if i'm wrong) and whatever the hell 3d realms was tryna do with prey in 1997, that stuff looked nuts.

unreal was a different sort of first person shooter and in a league of its own, taking a very different approach to level design and far more subtle approach to scripted sequences and storytelling. prey didn't come out until 2006, after human head picked up development from 3d realms. half-life could have had less polygons and lower res textues and STILL play as good. valve crafted an experience to soak in, you're just a scientist trying to do your own dang job! 

black mesa is a beautiful place, not a happy one, not a welcoming one. gordon is constantly on the run, he was late to work after all (maybe if that train was faster). but you have to learn the hard way what your employer's true intentions are. thankfully, there's a lot of running to do, jumping as well, black mesa isn't very safe either.

valve's use of scripted sequences and environmental storytelling is just as strong here is at continued to be until everyone got too addicted to multiplayer games, some things in the world you might already be familiar with, others you will at some point have to be familiar with to survive in the black mesa facility.

the game runs well on a modified quake 2 engine (shouts out john carmack), and got at least 60fps on a GeForce 2.
and still works well on a modern system (the framerate cap is there for a reason, elevators and trains do not work well past that limit)

the game sounds good too, using primitve but characteristic dsp and sample playback, the reverb in the air vents to this day is one of my favorite reverbs.

the gameplay is at it's core quake with jumping puzzles and scary bits instead of keycards and trent reznor's breathing. between all of the shooting and jumping action there are bit where the world is shown to you. you can take a step back and see the facility, hear from and save the employees (or just blow em to bits too if you want). there's plenty of alien as well military opposition because someone messed up big time. all of the weapons are satisfying, the monsters are all unique and there's even primitive but completely functional ai.


black mesa is a place i will be visiting again soon.
you should visit black mesa too.

valve's crowning achievement
i still wonder who is responsible for this mess

(also avaliable for sony's playstation 2 and a complete build for the dreamcast version is around)

It's just as incredible now as it was back when it came out over a decade ago. I absolutely love this game. I also highly recommend Opposing Force and Blue Shift, since they give different perspectives to the story and give you even more Half-life to play. In fact, just go get the Half-life 1 Anthology. It's just $5 extra from the price of Half-life by itself, so why the fuck not? Plus Team Fortress Classic, for whatever reason. It's more than worth the money.

Recieving praise from game sites as Valve's first game, without a doubt Half-Life is a materpiece. It has well made cutscenes where the player assumes complete control, and the voicing to go with it matches well. This immersion is a major moot for the game. The combination of combat and puzzle solving is a great duo. There were hard parts though where I didn't know where to go or fighting was a bit too cheap. Some enemies are easy, some are tougher, and there are boss type characters that challenge players. Still with some difficult parts, Half-Life is a game of shining merit. The weapons are well designed, along with the maps. Contrast between Black Mesa and Xen great, with the clash between normal science, military, and alien themes. The maps range from standard corridors to wide open spaces.
As Valve's first title filled with innovations, without a doubt, Half-Life is a groundbreaking game with many new ideas in it.

And if you do need a bit more frills, Black Mesa is an option.

The game that started it all, Half-Life gives a unique experience unlike any other.

Revolutionising first-person-shooters for its time, Half-Life combines gun play, scripted events, and generally imersive gameplay.

言わずと知れた名作「Half-Life」シリーズの第一作。10年以上前の作品ということもあり、流石にグラフィックに古さが現れているが、ストーリー・FPS要素・謎解き・敵のAIなど、多くの面で現在のFPSに勝るとも劣らない要素が多数搭載されており、全体のまとまりのよさと適度なボリュームと刺激を考えればこのmetascoreも納得が行くレベル。序盤の薄暗い中での探索では光源の関係か、若干酔ってしまったが、文句を付けるとしたらデフォルトで字幕が無いことを除けばそのぐらいだろうか。機会があれば是非プレイしてみることをオススメする。

The game that brought one of the modern monoliths of gaming to where it is, Half-Life is a Thoroughly enjoyable romp through the Black Mesa Research Facility, a Underground scientific haven (albiet lacking in OSHA compliance)  turned to a subterranean deathtrap after a teleportation experiment gone awry.

The GoldSrc Engine -- the game engine Half-Life runs on, and forerunner to the more modern Source engine -- still provides fresh experiences more than a decade after release through a healthy modding community, with such gems as 'Afraid of Monsters', 'Sven Co-Op', 'They Hunger', and dozens of other great mods running on the beloved Quakeworld derivative.

This game is worth the low amount Valve asks for it - Go ahead, take the plunge!

Not recommending this would be like telling someone not to watch Die Hard.
It's a classic. It's one of the few games of it's time that used scripted scenes to better advance it's story. It has interesting puzzles, shooting mechanics that still work today,  cool characters, and atmosphere. Buy this. Buy all of the expansions. Play through them all. Then pick up it's sequel, and all of it's expansions, or the orange box.
Got the money? buy it. Dont have it? commit a crime to buy it.

Half-Life ist der Shooter-Klassiker schlechthin und zurecht der Stolz und Grundstein von Valve. Kaum ein Spiel hat so viele Mods, Maps und Kompatibilität wie dieses Evergreen.

Die Half-Life-Engine ist zwar längst überholt, läuft aber dafür mittlerweile auf fast jedem Business-Desktop. 

Spieltiefe, Horroreinlagen und kleine Psychospielchen im Kopf von Gordon Freeman sorgen dafür, dass man die "alte Grafik" vergisst und sich ganz dem Spiel hingibt. Es ist bestimmt möglich, dieses Spiel recht schnell zu beenden, allerdings kann man es auch über mehrere Tage genießen.

Vom M.I.T.-Studenten zum gejagten Überlebenskünstler und alles in einer mitreißenden Story. 

Auch für Einsteiger zu empfehlen. Ein absolutes Muss für jeden Gamer...

A love letter to Physics Majors everywhere. Apparently, you're all really just crowbar wielding, bullet-spraying maniacs in glasses who look suspicuously like House.

Seriously though, Half life... did things. Disturbing things. Scary things. Amazing things. It didn't age as well visually as one might hope, but the gameplay, story and even the elements of horror as as fresh and outstanding as ever setting standards that even its amazing sequel couldn't touch. 

Half Life is the embodiment of genius, innovation, freedom and fun within the scope of what can be done in a videogame. At a cheap price anyone can afford and everyone should own, you can't stay out in the cold. Come in an enjoy the warmth of Black Mesa.
